result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven M. Urbaniak

11:23 AM Defendant Steven M. Urbaniak in court.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF138 and 22CF160.
Deft heard - is waiting to be appointed an Attorney through the Public Defenders office.
Had to provide additional information, which he has now submitted.

Deft heard on why he missed hearing.
Court heard and denies the request to forfeit the bond at this time.

Court imposes $1000 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.

3:31 PM Defendant Steven M. Urbaniak appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $3,200 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, Compliance with Soberlink, no entry into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
